108/*
109 * 4 debug categories are defined:
110 *
111 * CORE: Used in the generic drm code: drm_ioctl.c, drm_mm.c, drm_memory.c, ...
112 * This is the category used by the DRM_DEBUG() macro.
113 *
114 * DRIVER: Used in the vendor specific part of the driver: i915, radeon, ...
115 * This is the category used by the DRM_DEBUG_DRIVER() macro.
116 *
117 * KMS: used in the modesetting code.
118 * This is the category used by the DRM_DEBUG_KMS() macro.
119 *
120 * PRIME: used in the prime code.
121 * This is the category used by the DRM_DEBUG_PRIME() macro.
122 *
123 * ATOMIC: used in the atomic code.
124 * This is the category used by the DRM_DEBUG_ATOMIC() macro.
125 *
126 * VBL: used for verbose debug message in the vblank code
127 * This is the category used by the DRM_DEBUG_VBL() macro.
128 *
129 * Enabling verbose debug messages is done through the drm.debug parameter,
130 * each category being enabled by a bit.
131 *
132 * drm.debug=0x1 will enable CORE messages
133 * drm.debug=0x2 will enable DRIVER messages
134 * drm.debug=0x3 will enable CORE and DRIVER messages
135 * ...
136 * drm.debug=0x3f will enable all messages
137 *
138 * An interesting feature is that it's possible to enable verbose logging at
139 * run-time by echoing the debug value in its sysfs node:
140 * # echo 0xf > /sys/module/drm/parameters/debug
141 */
142#define DRM_UT_CORE 0x01
143#define DRM_UT_DRIVER 0x02
144#define DRM_UT_KMS 0x04
145#define DRM_UT_PRIME 0x08
146#define DRM_UT_ATOMIC 0x10
147#define DRM_UT_VBL 0x20
148
149extern __printf(2, 3)
150void drm_ut_debug_printk(const char *function_name,
151 const char *format, ...);
152extern __printf(4, 5)
153void drm_err(const char *file, int line, const char *func, const char *format, ...);
154
155/***********************************************************************/
156/** \name DRM template customization defaults */
157/*@{*/
158
159/* driver capabilities and requirements mask */
160#define DRIVER_USE_AGP 0x1
161#define DRIVER_PCI_DMA 0x8
162#define DRIVER_SG 0x10
163#define DRIVER_HAVE_DMA 0x20
164#define DRIVER_HAVE_IRQ 0x40
165#define DRIVER_IRQ_SHARED 0x80
166#define DRIVER_GEM 0x1000
167#define DRIVER_MODESET 0x2000
168#define DRIVER_PRIME 0x4000
169#define DRIVER_RENDER 0x8000
170#define DRIVER_ATOMIC 0x10000
171#define DRIVER_KMS_LEGACY_CONTEXT 0x20000
172
173/***********************************************************************/
174/** \name Macros to make printk easier */
175/*@{*/
176
177#define _DRM_PRINTK(once, level, fmt, ...) \
178 do { \
179 printk##once(KERN_##level "[" DRM_NAME "] " fmt, \
180 ##__VA_ARGS__); \
181 } while (0)
182
183#define DRM_INFO(fmt, ...) \
184 _DRM_PRINTK(, INFO, fmt, ##__VA_ARGS__)
185#define DRM_NOTE(fmt, ...) \
186 _DRM_PRINTK(, NOTICE, fmt, ##__VA_ARGS__)
187#define DRM_WARN(fmt, ...) \
188 _DRM_PRINTK(, WARNING, fmt, ##__VA_ARGS__)
189
190#define DRM_INFO_ONCE(fmt, ...) \
191 _DRM_PRINTK(_once, INFO, fmt, ##__VA_ARGS__)
192#define DRM_NOTE_ONCE(fmt, ...) \
193 _DRM_PRINTK(_once, NOTICE, fmt, ##__VA_ARGS__)
194#define DRM_WARN_ONCE(fmt, ...) \
195 _DRM_PRINTK(_once, WARNING, fmt, ##__VA_ARGS__)
196
197/**
198 * Error output.
199 *
200 * \param fmt printf() like format string.
201 * \param arg arguments
202 */
203#define DRM_ERROR(fmt, ...) \
204 drm_err(__FILE__, __LINE__, __func__, fmt, ##__VA_ARGS__)
205
206/**
207 * Rate limited error output. Like DRM_ERROR() but won't flood the log.
208 *
209 * \param fmt printf() like format string.
210 * \param arg arguments
211 */
212#define DRM_ERROR_RATELIMITED(fmt, ...) \
213({ \
214 static DEFINE_RATELIMIT_STATE(_rs, \
215 DEFAULT_RATELIMIT_INTERVAL, \
216 DEFAULT_RATELIMIT_BURST); \
217 \
218 if (__ratelimit(&_rs)) \
219 drm_err(__FILE__, __LINE__, __func__, fmt, ##__VA_ARGS__); \
220})
221
222/**
223 * Debug output.
224 *
225 * \param fmt printf() like format string.
226 * \param arg arguments
227 */
228#define DRM_DEBUG(fmt, args...) \
229 do { \
230 if (unlikely(drm_debug & DRM_UT_CORE)) \
231 drm_ut_debug_printk(__func__, fmt, ##args); \
232 } while (0)
233
234#define DRM_DEBUG_DRIVER(fmt, args...) \
235 do { \
236 if (unlikely(drm_debug & DRM_UT_DRIVER)) \
237 drm_ut_debug_printk(__func__, fmt, ##args); \
238 } while (0)
239#define DRM_DEBUG_KMS(fmt, args...) \
240 do { \
241 if (unlikely(drm_debug & DRM_UT_KMS)) \
242 drm_ut_debug_printk(__func__, fmt, ##args); \
243 } while (0)
244#define DRM_DEBUG_PRIME(fmt, args...) \
245 do { \
246 if (unlikely(drm_debug & DRM_UT_PRIME)) \
247 drm_ut_debug_printk(__func__, fmt, ##args); \
248 } while (0)
249#define DRM_DEBUG_ATOMIC(fmt, args...) \
250 do { \
251 if (unlikely(drm_debug & DRM_UT_ATOMIC)) \
252 drm_ut_debug_printk(__func__, fmt, ##args); \
253 } while (0)
254#define DRM_DEBUG_VBL(fmt, args...) \
255 do { \
256 if (unlikely(drm_debug & DRM_UT_VBL)) \
257 drm_ut_debug_printk(__func__, fmt, ##args); \
258 } while (0)
259
260/*@}*/
261
262/***********************************************************************/
263/** \name Internal types and structures */
264/*@{*/
265
266#define DRM_IF_VERSION(maj, min) (maj << 16 | min)
267
268/**
269 * Ioctl function type.
270 *
271 * \param inode device inode.
272 * \param file_priv DRM file private pointer.
273 * \param cmd command.
274 * \param arg argument.
275 */
276typedef int drm_ioctl_t(struct drm_device *dev, void *data,
277 struct drm_file *file_priv);
278
279typedef int drm_ioctl_compat_t(struct file *filp, unsigned int cmd,
280 unsigned long arg);
281
282#ifdef __NetBSD__
283/* XXX Kludge...is there a better way to do this? */
284#define DRM_IOCTL_NR(n) \
285 (IOCBASECMD(n) &~ (IOC_DIRMASK | (IOCGROUP(n) << IOCGROUP_SHIFT)))
286#define DRM_MAJOR cdevsw_lookup_major(&drm_cdevsw)
287#else
288#define DRM_IOCTL_NR(n) _IOC_NR(n)
289#define DRM_MAJOR 226
290#endif
291
292#define DRM_AUTH 0x1
293#define DRM_MASTER 0x2
294#define DRM_ROOT_ONLY 0x4
295#define DRM_CONTROL_ALLOW 0x8
296#define DRM_UNLOCKED 0x10
297#define DRM_RENDER_ALLOW 0x20
298
299struct drm_ioctl_desc {
300 unsigned int cmd;
301 int flags;
302 drm_ioctl_t *func;
303 const char *name;
304};
305
306/**
307 * Creates a driver or general drm_ioctl_desc array entry for the given
308 * ioctl, for use by drm_ioctl().
309 */
310
311#define DRM_IOCTL_DEF_DRV(ioctl, _func, _flags) \
312 [DRM_IOCTL_NR(DRM_IOCTL_##ioctl) - DRM_COMMAND_BASE] = { \
313 .cmd = DRM_IOCTL_##ioctl, \
314 .func = _func, \
315 .flags = _flags, \
316 .name = #ioctl \
317 }
318
319/* Event queued up for userspace to read */
320struct drm_pending_event {
321 struct drm_event *event;
322 struct list_head link;
323 struct drm_file *file_priv;
324 pid_t pid; /* pid of requester, no guarantee it's valid by the time
325 we deliver the event, for tracing only */
326 void (*destroy)(struct drm_pending_event *event);
327};
328
329/* initial implementaton using a linked list - todo hashtab */
330struct drm_prime_file_private {
331 struct list_head head;
332 struct mutex lock;
333};
334
335/** File private data */
336struct drm_file {
337 unsigned authenticated :1;
338 /* Whether we're master for a minor. Protected by master_mutex */
339 unsigned is_master :1;
340 /* true when the client has asked us to expose stereo 3D mode flags */
341 unsigned stereo_allowed :1;
342 /*
343 * true if client understands CRTC primary planes and cursor planes
344 * in the plane list
345 */
346 unsigned universal_planes:1;
347 /* true if client understands atomic properties */
348 unsigned atomic:1;
349 /*
350 * This client is allowed to gain master privileges for @master.
351 * Protected by struct drm_device::master_mutex.
352 */
353 unsigned allowed_master:1;
354
355#ifndef __NetBSD__
356 struct pid *pid;
357 kuid_t uid;
358#endif
359 drm_magic_t magic;
360 struct list_head lhead;
361 struct drm_minor *minor;
362 unsigned long lock_count;
363
364 /** Mapping of mm object handles to object pointers. */
365 struct idr object_idr;
366 /** Lock for synchronization of access to object_idr. */
367 spinlock_t table_lock;
368
369 struct file *filp;
370 void *driver_priv;
371
372 struct drm_master *master; /* master this node is currently associated with
373 N.B. not always minor->master */
374 /**
375 * fbs - List of framebuffers associated with this file.
376 *
377 * Protected by fbs_lock. Note that the fbs list holds a reference on
378 * the fb object to prevent it from untimely disappearing.
379 */
380 struct list_head fbs;
381 struct mutex fbs_lock;
382
383 /** User-created blob properties; this retains a reference on the
384 * property. */
385 struct list_head blobs;
386
387#ifdef __NetBSD__
388 drm_waitqueue_t event_wait;
389 struct selinfo event_selq;
390#else
391 wait_queue_head_t event_wait;
392#endif
393 struct list_head event_list;
394 int event_space;
395
396 struct drm_prime_file_private prime;
397};
398
399/**
400 * Lock data.
401 */
402struct drm_lock_data {
403 struct drm_hw_lock *hw_lock; /**< Hardware lock */
404 /** Private of lock holder's file (NULL=kernel) */
405 struct drm_file *file_priv;
406#ifdef __NetBSD__
407 drm_waitqueue_t lock_queue; /**< Queue of blocked processes */
408#else
409 wait_queue_head_t lock_queue; /**< Queue of blocked processes */
410#endif
411 unsigned long lock_time; /**< Time of last lock in jiffies */
412 spinlock_t spinlock;
413 uint32_t kernel_waiters;
414 uint32_t user_waiters;
415 int idle_has_lock;
416};
417
418/**
419 * struct drm_master - drm master structure
420 *
421 * @refcount: Refcount for this master object.
422 * @minor: Link back to minor char device we are master for. Immutable.
423 * @unique: Unique identifier: e.g. busid. Protected by drm_global_mutex.
424 * @unique_len: Length of unique field. Protected by drm_global_mutex.
425 * @magic_map: Map of used authentication tokens. Protected by struct_mutex.
426 * @lock: DRI lock information.
427 * @driver_priv: Pointer to driver-private information.
428 */
429struct drm_master {
430 struct kref refcount;
431 struct drm_minor *minor;
432 char *unique;
433 int unique_len;
434 struct idr magic_map;
435 struct drm_lock_data lock;
436 void *driver_priv;
437};
438
439/* Size of ringbuffer for vblank timestamps. Just double-buffer
440 * in initial implementation.
441 */
442#define DRM_VBLANKTIME_RBSIZE 2
443
444/* Flags and return codes for get_vblank_timestamp() driver function. */
445#define DRM_CALLED_FROM_VBLIRQ 1
446#define DRM_VBLANKTIME_SCANOUTPOS_METHOD (1 << 0)
447#define DRM_VBLANKTIME_IN_VBLANK (1 << 1)
448
449/* get_scanout_position() return flags */
450#define DRM_SCANOUTPOS_VALID (1 << 0)
451#define DRM_SCANOUTPOS_IN_VBLANK (1 << 1)
452#define DRM_SCANOUTPOS_ACCURATE (1 << 2)
453
454/**
455 * DRM driver structure. This structure represent the common code for
456 * a family of cards. There will one drm_device for each card present
457 * in this family
458 */
459struct drm_driver {
460 int (*load) (struct drm_device *, unsigned long flags);
461 int (*firstopen) (struct drm_device *);
462 int (*open) (struct drm_device *, struct drm_file *);
463 void (*preclose) (struct drm_device *, struct drm_file *file_priv);
464 void (*postclose) (struct drm_device *, struct drm_file *);
465 void (*lastclose) (struct drm_device *);
466 int (*unload) (struct drm_device *);
467 int (*suspend) (struct drm_device *, pm_message_t state);
468 int (*resume) (struct drm_device *);
469 int (*dma_ioctl) (struct drm_device *dev, void *data, struct drm_file *file_priv);
470 int (*dma_quiescent) (struct drm_device *);
471 int (*context_dtor) (struct drm_device *dev, int context);
472 int (*set_busid)(struct drm_device *dev, struct drm_master *master);
473 int (*set_unique)(struct drm_device *dev, struct drm_master *master,
474 struct drm_unique *);
475
476 /**
477 * get_vblank_counter - get raw hardware vblank counter
478 * @dev: DRM device
479 * @pipe: counter to fetch
480 *
481 * Driver callback for fetching a raw hardware vblank counter for @crtc.
482 * If a device doesn't have a hardware counter, the driver can simply
483 * return the value of drm_vblank_count. The DRM core will account for
484 * missed vblank events while interrupts where disabled based on system
485 * timestamps.
486 *
487 * Wraparound handling and loss of events due to modesetting is dealt
488 * with in the DRM core code.
489 *
490 * RETURNS
491 * Raw vblank counter value.
492 */
493 u32 (*get_vblank_counter) (struct drm_device *dev, unsigned int pipe);
494
495 /**
496 * enable_vblank - enable vblank interrupt events
497 * @dev: DRM device
498 * @pipe: which irq to enable
499 *
500 * Enable vblank interrupts for @crtc. If the device doesn't have
501 * a hardware vblank counter, this routine should be a no-op, since
502 * interrupts will have to stay on to keep the count accurate.
503 *
504 * RETURNS
505 * Zero on success, appropriate errno if the given @crtc's vblank
506 * interrupt cannot be enabled.
507 */
508 int (*enable_vblank) (struct drm_device *dev, unsigned int pipe);
509
510 /**
511 * disable_vblank - disable vblank interrupt events
512 * @dev: DRM device
513 * @pipe: which irq to enable
514 *
515 * Disable vblank interrupts for @crtc. If the device doesn't have
516 * a hardware vblank counter, this routine should be a no-op, since
517 * interrupts will have to stay on to keep the count accurate.
518 */
519 void (*disable_vblank) (struct drm_device *dev, unsigned int pipe);
520
521 /**
522 * Called by \c drm_device_is_agp. Typically used to determine if a
523 * card is really attached to AGP or not.
524 *
525 * \param dev DRM device handle
526 *
527 * \returns
528 * One of three values is returned depending on whether or not the
529 * card is absolutely \b not AGP (return of 0), absolutely \b is AGP
530 * (return of 1), or may or may not be AGP (return of 2).
531 */
532 int (*device_is_agp) (struct drm_device *dev);
533
534 /**
535 * Called by vblank timestamping code.
536 *
537 * Return the current display scanout position from a crtc, and an
538 * optional accurate ktime_get timestamp of when position was measured.
539 *
540 * \param dev DRM device.
541 * \param pipe Id of the crtc to query.
542 * \param flags Flags from the caller (DRM_CALLED_FROM_VBLIRQ or 0).
543 * \param *vpos Target location for current vertical scanout position.
544 * \param *hpos Target location for current horizontal scanout position.
545 * \param *stime Target location for timestamp taken immediately before
546 * scanout position query. Can be NULL to skip timestamp.
547 * \param *etime Target location for timestamp taken immediately after
548 * scanout position query. Can be NULL to skip timestamp.
549 * \param mode Current display timings.
550 *
551 * Returns vpos as a positive number while in active scanout area.
552 * Returns vpos as a negative number inside vblank, counting the number
553 * of scanlines to go until end of vblank, e.g., -1 means "one scanline
554 * until start of active scanout / end of vblank."
555 *
556 * \return Flags, or'ed together as follows:
557 *
558 * DRM_SCANOUTPOS_VALID = Query successful.
559 * DRM_SCANOUTPOS_INVBL = Inside vblank.
560 * DRM_SCANOUTPOS_ACCURATE = Returned position is accurate. A lack of
561 * this flag means that returned position may be offset by a constant
562 * but unknown small number of scanlines wrt. real scanout position.
563 *
564 */
565 int (*get_scanout_position) (struct drm_device *dev, unsigned int pipe,
566 unsigned int flags, int *vpos, int *hpos,
567 ktime_t *stime, ktime_t *etime,
568 const struct drm_display_mode *mode);
569
570 /**
571 * Called by \c drm_get_last_vbltimestamp. Should return a precise
572 * timestamp when the most recent VBLANK interval ended or will end.
573 *
574 * Specifically, the timestamp in @vblank_time should correspond as
575 * closely as possible to the time when the first video scanline of
576 * the video frame after the end of VBLANK will start scanning out,
577 * the time immediately after end of the VBLANK interval. If the
578 * @crtc is currently inside VBLANK, this will be a time in the future.
579 * If the @crtc is currently scanning out a frame, this will be the
580 * past start time of the current scanout. This is meant to adhere
581 * to the OpenML OML_sync_control extension specification.
582 *
583 * \param dev dev DRM device handle.
584 * \param pipe crtc for which timestamp should be returned.
585 * \param *max_error Maximum allowable timestamp error in nanoseconds.
586 * Implementation should strive to provide timestamp
587 * with an error of at most *max_error nanoseconds.
588 * Returns true upper bound on error for timestamp.
589 * \param *vblank_time Target location for returned vblank timestamp.
590 * \param flags 0 = Defaults, no special treatment needed.
591 * \param DRM_CALLED_FROM_VBLIRQ = Function is called from vblank
592 * irq handler. Some drivers need to apply some workarounds
593 * for gpu-specific vblank irq quirks if flag is set.
594 *
595 * \returns
596 * Zero if timestamping isn't supported in current display mode or a
597 * negative number on failure. A positive status code on success,
598 * which describes how the vblank_time timestamp was computed.
599 */
600 int (*get_vblank_timestamp) (struct drm_device *dev, unsigned int pipe,
601 int *max_error,
602 struct timeval *vblank_time,
603 unsigned flags);
604
605 /* these have to be filled in */
606
607 irqreturn_t(*irq_handler) (DRM_IRQ_ARGS);
608 void (*irq_preinstall) (struct drm_device *dev);
609 int (*irq_postinstall) (struct drm_device *dev);
610 void (*irq_uninstall) (struct drm_device *dev);
611
612#ifdef __NetBSD__
613 int (*request_irq)(struct drm_device *, int);
614 void (*free_irq)(struct drm_device *);
615#endif
616
617 /* Master routines */
618 int (*master_create)(struct drm_device *dev, struct drm_master *master);
619 void (*master_destroy)(struct drm_device *dev, struct drm_master *master);
620 /**
621 * master_set is called whenever the minor master is set.
622 * master_drop is called whenever the minor master is dropped.
623 */
624
625 int (*master_set)(struct drm_device *dev, struct drm_file *file_priv,
626 bool from_open);
627 void (*master_drop)(struct drm_device *dev, struct drm_file *file_priv,
628 bool from_release);
629
630 int (*debugfs_init)(struct drm_minor *minor);
631 void (*debugfs_cleanup)(struct drm_minor *minor);
632
633 /**
634 * Driver-specific constructor for drm_gem_objects, to set up
635 * obj->driver_private.
636 *
637 * Returns 0 on success.
638 */
639 void (*gem_free_object) (struct drm_gem_object *obj);
640 int (*gem_open_object) (struct drm_gem_object *, struct drm_file *);
641 void (*gem_close_object) (struct drm_gem_object *, struct drm_file *);
642
643 /* prime: */
644 /* export handle -> fd (see drm_gem_prime_handle_to_fd() helper) */
645 int (*prime_handle_to_fd)(struct drm_device *dev, struct drm_file *file_priv,
646 uint32_t handle, uint32_t flags, int *prime_fd);
647 /* import fd -> handle (see drm_gem_prime_fd_to_handle() helper) */
648 int (*prime_fd_to_handle)(struct drm_device *dev, struct drm_file *file_priv,
649 int prime_fd, uint32_t *handle);
650 /* export GEM -> dmabuf */
651 struct dma_buf * (*gem_prime_export)(struct drm_device *dev,
652 struct drm_gem_object *obj, int flags);
653 /* import dmabuf -> GEM */
654 struct drm_gem_object * (*gem_prime_import)(struct drm_device *dev,
655 struct dma_buf *dma_buf);
656 /* low-level interface used by drm_gem_prime_{import,export} */
657 int (*gem_prime_pin)(struct drm_gem_object *obj);
658 void (*gem_prime_unpin)(struct drm_gem_object *obj);
659 struct reservation_object * (*gem_prime_res_obj)(
660 struct drm_gem_object *obj);
661 struct sg_table *(*gem_prime_get_sg_table)(struct drm_gem_object *obj);
662 struct drm_gem_object *(*gem_prime_import_sg_table)(
663 struct drm_device *dev,
664 struct dma_buf_attachment *attach,
665 struct sg_table *sgt);
666 void *(*gem_prime_vmap)(struct drm_gem_object *obj);
667 void (*gem_prime_vunmap)(struct drm_gem_object *obj, void *vaddr);
668#ifdef __NetBSD__
669 int (*gem_prime_mmap)(struct drm_gem_object *obj, off_t *offp,
670 size_t len, int prot, int *flagsp, int *advicep,
671 struct uvm_object **uobjp, int *maxprotp);
672#else
673 int (*gem_prime_mmap)(struct drm_gem_object *obj,
674 struct vm_area_struct *vma);
675#endif
676
677 /* vga arb irq handler */
678 void (*vgaarb_irq)(struct drm_device *dev, bool state);
679
680 /* dumb alloc support */
681 int (*dumb_create)(struct drm_file *file_priv,
682 struct drm_device *dev,
683 struct drm_mode_create_dumb *args);
684 int (*dumb_map_offset)(struct drm_file *file_priv,
685 struct drm_device *dev, uint32_t handle,
686 uint64_t *offset);
687 int (*dumb_destroy)(struct drm_file *file_priv,
688 struct drm_device *dev,
689 uint32_t handle);
690
691 /* Driver private ops for this object */
692#ifdef __NetBSD__
693 int (*mmap_object)(struct drm_device *, off_t, size_t, int,
694 struct uvm_object **, voff_t *, struct file *);
695 const struct uvm_pagerops *gem_uvm_ops;
696#else
697 const struct vm_operations_struct *gem_vm_ops;
698#endif
699
700 int major;
701 int minor;
702 int patchlevel;
703 const char *name;
704 const char *desc;
705 const char *date;
706
707 u32 driver_features;
708 int dev_priv_size;
709 const struct drm_ioctl_desc *ioctls;
710 int num_ioctls;
711 const struct file_operations *fops;
712
713#ifdef __NetBSD__
714 int (*ioctl_override)(struct file *, unsigned long, void *);
715#endif
716
717 /* List of devices hanging off this driver with stealth attach. */
718 struct list_head legacy_dev_list;
719};
720
721enum drm_minor_type {
722 DRM_MINOR_LEGACY,
723 DRM_MINOR_CONTROL,
724 DRM_MINOR_RENDER,
725 DRM_MINOR_CNT,
726};
727
728#ifdef __NetBSD__ /* XXX debugfs */
729struct seq_file;
730#endif
731
732/**
733 * Info file list entry. This structure represents a debugfs or proc file to
734 * be created by the drm core
735 */
736struct drm_info_list {
737 const char *name; /** file name */
738 int (*show)(struct seq_file*, void*); /** show callback */
739 u32 driver_features; /**< Required driver features for this entry */
740 void *data;
741};
742
743/**
744 * debugfs node structure. This structure represents a debugfs file.
745 */
746struct drm_info_node {
747 struct list_head list;
748 struct drm_minor *minor;
749 const struct drm_info_list *info_ent;
750 struct dentry *dent;
751};
752
753/**
754 * DRM minor structure. This structure represents a drm minor number.
755 */
756struct drm_minor {
757 int index; /**< Minor device number */
758 int type; /**< Control or render */
759 struct device *kdev; /**< Linux device */
760 struct drm_device *dev;
761
762#ifndef __NetBSD__ /* XXX debugfs */
763 struct dentry *debugfs_root;
764
765 struct list_head debugfs_list;
766 struct mutex debugfs_lock; /* Protects debugfs_list. */
767#endif
768
769 /* currently active master for this node. Protected by master_mutex */
770 struct drm_master *master;
771};
772
773
774struct drm_pending_vblank_event {
775 struct drm_pending_event base;
776 unsigned int pipe;
777 struct drm_event_vblank event;
778};
779
780struct drm_vblank_crtc {
781 struct drm_device *dev; /* pointer to the drm_device */
782#ifdef __NetBSD__
783 drm_waitqueue_t queue;
784#else
785 wait_queue_head_t queue; /**< VBLANK wait queue */
786#endif
787 struct timer_list disable_timer; /* delayed disable timer */
788
789 /* vblank counter, protected by dev->vblank_time_lock for writes */
790 u32 count;
791 /* vblank timestamps, protected by dev->vblank_time_lock for writes */
792 struct timeval time[DRM_VBLANKTIME_RBSIZE];
793
794 atomic_t refcount; /* number of users of vblank interruptsper crtc */
795 u32 last; /* protected by dev->vbl_lock, used */
796 /* for wraparound handling */
797 u32 last_wait; /* Last vblank seqno waited per CRTC */
798 unsigned int inmodeset; /* Display driver is setting mode */
799 unsigned int pipe; /* crtc index */
800 int framedur_ns; /* frame/field duration in ns */
801 int linedur_ns; /* line duration in ns */
802 bool enabled; /* so we don't call enable more than
803 once per disable */
804};
805
806/**
807 * DRM device structure. This structure represent a complete card that
808 * may contain multiple heads.
809 */
810struct drm_device {
811 struct list_head legacy_dev_list;/**< list of devices per driver for stealth attach cleanup */
812 int if_version; /**< Highest interface version set */
813
814 /** \name Lifetime Management */
815 /*@{ */
816 struct kref ref; /**< Object ref-count */
817 struct device *dev; /**< Device structure of bus-device */
818 struct drm_driver *driver; /**< DRM driver managing the device */
819 void *dev_private; /**< DRM driver private data */
820 struct drm_minor *control; /**< Control node */
821 struct drm_minor *primary; /**< Primary node */
822 struct drm_minor *render; /**< Render node */
823 atomic_t unplugged; /**< Flag whether dev is dead */
824 struct inode *anon_inode; /**< inode for private address-space */
825 char *unique; /**< unique name of the device */
826 /*@} */
827
828 /** \name Locks */
829 /*@{ */
830 struct mutex struct_mutex; /**< For others */
831 struct mutex master_mutex; /**< For drm_minor::master and drm_file::is_master */
832 /*@} */
833
834 /** \name Usage Counters */
835 /*@{ */
836 int open_count; /**< Outstanding files open, protected by drm_global_mutex. */
837 spinlock_t buf_lock; /**< For drm_device::buf_use and a few other things. */
838 int buf_use; /**< Buffers in use -- cannot alloc */
839 atomic_t buf_alloc; /**< Buffer allocation in progress */
840 /*@} */
841
842 struct list_head filelist;
843
844 /** \name Memory management */
845 /*@{ */
846 struct list_head maplist; /**< Linked list of regions */
847 struct drm_open_hash map_hash; /**< User token hash table for maps */
848
849 /** \name Context handle management */
850 /*@{ */
851 struct list_head ctxlist; /**< Linked list of context handles */
852 struct mutex ctxlist_mutex; /**< For ctxlist */
853
854 struct idr ctx_idr;
855
856 struct list_head vmalist; /**< List of vmas (for debugging) */
857
858 /*@} */
859
860 /** \name DMA support */
861 /*@{ */
862 struct drm_device_dma *dma; /**< Optional pointer for DMA support */
863 /*@} */
864
865 /** \name Context support */
866 /*@{ */
867
868 __volatile__ long context_flag; /**< Context swapping flag */
869 int last_context; /**< Last current context */
870 /*@} */
871
872 /** \name VBLANK IRQ support */
873 /*@{ */
874 bool irq_enabled;
875 int irq;
876#ifdef __NetBSD__
877 struct drm_bus_irq_cookie *irq_cookie;
878#endif
879
880 /*
881 * At load time, disabling the vblank interrupt won't be allowed since
882 * old clients may not call the modeset ioctl and therefore misbehave.
883 * Once the modeset ioctl *has* been called though, we can safely
884 * disable them when unused.
885 */
886 bool vblank_disable_allowed;
887
888 /*
889 * If true, vblank interrupt will be disabled immediately when the
890 * refcount drops to zero, as opposed to via the vblank disable
891 * timer.
892 * This can be set to true it the hardware has a working vblank
893 * counter and the driver uses drm_vblank_on() and drm_vblank_off()
894 * appropriately.
895 */
896 bool vblank_disable_immediate;
897
898 /* array of size num_crtcs */
899 struct drm_vblank_crtc *vblank;
900
901 spinlock_t vblank_time_lock; /**< Protects vblank count and time updates during vblank enable/disable */
902 spinlock_t vbl_lock;
903
904 u32 max_vblank_count; /**< size of vblank counter register */
905
906 /**
907 * List of events
908 */
909 struct list_head vblank_event_list;
910 spinlock_t event_lock;
911
912 /*@} */
913
914 struct drm_agp_head *agp; /**< AGP data */
915
916 struct pci_dev *pdev; /**< PCI device structure */
917#ifdef __alpha__
918 struct pci_controller *hose;
919#endif
920
921 struct platform_device *platformdev; /**< Platform device struture */
922 struct virtio_device *virtdev;
923
924#ifdef __NetBSD__
925 bus_space_tag_t bst;
926 struct drm_bus_map *bus_maps;
927 unsigned bus_nmaps;
928 bus_dma_tag_t bus_dmat; /* bus's full DMA tag, for internal use */
929 bus_dma_tag_t bus_dmat32; /* bus's 32-bit DMA tag */
930 bus_dma_tag_t dmat; /* DMA tag for driver, may be subregion */
931 bool dmat_subregion_p;
932 bus_addr_t dmat_subregion_min;
933 bus_addr_t dmat_subregion_max;
934#endif
935
936 struct drm_sg_mem *sg; /**< Scatter gather memory */
937 unsigned int num_crtcs; /**< Number of CRTCs on this device */
938
939 struct {
940 int context;
941 struct drm_hw_lock *lock;
942 } sigdata;
943
944 struct drm_local_map *agp_buffer_map;
945 unsigned int agp_buffer_token;
946
947 struct drm_mode_config mode_config; /**< Current mode config */
948
949 /** \name GEM information */
950 /*@{ */
951 struct mutex object_name_lock;
952 struct idr object_name_idr;
953 struct drm_vma_offset_manager *vma_offset_manager;
954 /*@} */
955 int switch_power_state;
956};
957
958#define DRM_SWITCH_POWER_ON 0
959#define DRM_SWITCH_POWER_OFF 1
960#define DRM_SWITCH_POWER_CHANGING 2
961#define DRM_SWITCH_POWER_DYNAMIC_OFF 3
962
963static __inline__ int drm_core_check_feature(struct drm_device *dev,
964 int feature)
965{
966 return ((dev->driver->driver_features & feature) ? 1 : 0);
967}
968
969static inline void drm_device_set_unplugged(struct drm_device *dev)
970{
971 smp_wmb();
972 atomic_set(&dev->unplugged, 1);
973}
974
975static inline int drm_device_is_unplugged(struct drm_device *dev)
976{
977 int ret = atomic_read(&dev->unplugged);
978 smp_rmb();
979 return ret;
980}
981
982static inline bool drm_is_render_client(const struct drm_file *file_priv)
983{
984 return file_priv->minor->type == DRM_MINOR_RENDER;
985}
986
987static inline bool drm_is_control_client(const struct drm_file *file_priv)
988{
989 return file_priv->minor->type == DRM_MINOR_CONTROL;
990}
991
992static inline bool drm_is_primary_client(const struct drm_file *file_priv)
993{
994 return file_priv->minor->type == DRM_MINOR_LEGACY;
995}

1051 * DMA quiscent + idle. DMA quiescent usually requires the hardware lock.

1080extern bool drm_crtc_handle_vblank(struct drm_crtc *crtc);

1083extern int drm_crtc_vblank_get(struct drm_crtc *crtc);
1084extern void drm_crtc_vblank_put(struct drm_crtc *crtc);
1085extern int drm_vblank_get_locked(struct drm_device *dev, unsigned int pipe);
1086extern void drm_vblank_put_locked(struct drm_device *dev, unsigned int pipe);
1087extern int drm_crtc_vblank_get_locked(struct drm_crtc *crtc);
1088extern void drm_crtc_vblank_put_locked(struct drm_crtc *crtc);

1100 unsigned int pipe, int *max_error,
1101 struct timeval *vblank_time,
1102 unsigned flags,
1103 const struct drm_display_mode *mode);

1106
1107/**
1108 * drm_crtc_vblank_waitqueue - get vblank waitqueue for the CRTC
1109 * @crtc: which CRTC's vblank waitqueue to retrieve
1110 *
1111 * This function returns a pointer to the vblank waitqueue for the CRTC.
1112 * Drivers can use this to implement vblank waits using wait_event() & co.
1113 */
1114#ifdef __NetBSD__
1115static inline drm_waitqueue_t *drm_crtc_vblank_waitqueue(struct drm_crtc *crtc)
1116#else
1117static inline wait_queue_head_t *drm_crtc_vblank_waitqueue(struct drm_crtc *crtc)
1118#endif
1119{
1120 return &crtc->dev->vblank[drm_crtc_index(crtc)].queue;
1121}

1213/*@}*/
1214
1215/* PCI section */
1216static __inline__ int drm_pci_device_is_agp(struct drm_device *dev)
1217{
1218 if (dev->driver->device_is_agp != NULL) {
1219 int err = (*dev->driver->device_is_agp) (dev);
1220
1221 if (err != 2) {
1222 return err;
1223 }
1224 }
1225
1226 return pci_find_capability(dev->pdev, PCI_CAP_ID_AGP);
1227}
1228void drm_pci_agp_destroy(struct drm_device *dev);
1229
1230extern int drm_pci_init(struct drm_driver *driver, struct pci_driver *pdriver);
1231extern void drm_pci_exit(struct drm_driver *driver, struct pci_driver *pdriver);
1232#ifdef __NetBSD__
1233int drm_pci_request_irq(struct drm_device *, int);
1234void drm_pci_free_irq(struct drm_device *);
1235extern int drm_pci_attach(device_t, const struct pci_attach_args *,
1236 struct pci_dev *, struct drm_driver *, unsigned long,
1237 struct drm_device **);
1238extern int drm_pci_detach(struct drm_device *, int);
1239#endif
1240#ifdef CONFIG_PCI
1241extern int drm_get_pci_dev(struct pci_dev *pdev,
1242 const struct pci_device_id *ent,
1243 struct drm_driver *driver);
1244extern int drm_pci_set_busid(struct drm_device *dev, struct drm_master *master);
1245#else
1246static inline int drm_get_pci_dev(struct pci_dev *pdev,
1247 const struct pci_device_id *ent,
1248 struct drm_driver *driver)
1249{
1250 return -ENOSYS;
1251}
1252
1253static inline int drm_pci_set_busid(struct drm_device *dev,
1254 struct drm_master *master)
1255{
1256 return -ENOSYS;
1257}
1258#endif

1260#define DRM_PCIE_SPEED_25 1
1261#define DRM_PCIE_SPEED_50 2
1262#define DRM_PCIE_SPEED_80 4
1263
1264extern int drm_pcie_get_speed_cap_mask(struct drm_device *dev, u32 *speed_mask);

1266/* platform section */
1267extern int drm_platform_init(struct drm_driver *driver, struct platform_device *platform_device);
1268extern int drm_platform_set_busid(struct drm_device *d, struct drm_master *m);
1269
1270/* returns true if currently okay to sleep */
1271static __inline__ bool drm_can_sleep(void)
1272{
1273#ifdef __NetBSD__
1274 return false; /* XXX */
1275#else
1276 if (in_atomic() || in_dbg_master() || irqs_disabled())
1277 return false;
1278 return true;
1279#endif
1280}

1282#ifdef __NetBSD__
1283
1284/* XXX This is pretty kludgerific. */
1285
1286#include <linux/io-mapping.h>
1287
1288static inline struct io_mapping *
1289drm_io_mapping_create_wc(struct drm_device *dev, resource_size_t addr,
1290 unsigned long size)
1291{
1292 return bus_space_io_mapping_create_wc(dev->bst, addr, size);
1293}
1294
1295#endif /* defined(__NetBSD__) */
1296
1297#ifdef __NetBSD__
1298extern const struct cdevsw drm_cdevsw;
1299#endif
1300
1301#endif
